result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Jared J Wolak was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jared J Wolak

defendant.name: Wolak, Jared J
defendant.address: 10395 S Long Lake Road, Iron River, WI 54847

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order of discharge upon expiration of commitment
Letter from DOC with proposed order

Defendant Jared J Wolak in court with attorney Courtney J Latzig.  Kimberly Lawton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Social Worker, Samantha Hedican present in the courtroom.  
Court: petition to revoke conditional release.  DA Lawton w/d petition; spoke with Ms. Hedican about w/d;  expiration 08-01-2017, underlying allegation includes disorderly conduct with threats of violence, but no violence.  For 6 months he has not been taking prescribed medications;  plan he be off medications was not supported by the social worker; treatment team with CCS was supporting his medications w/held.  Mr. Wolak is willing to go to BHU until stabalized, then go to crisis bed until ready to continue conditional release.  He is currently on bond.  Atty Latzig; agrees with DA recitation of agreement.  DA Lawton; stats require Winnebago or Mendota, not jail if conditional release revoked; he does have other rules of supervision; voluntary inpatient at BHU, if he does not follow agreement, DOC can again petition for release of condition release.
Ms. Hedican responds; concern for everyone's safety; if he is willing to BHU and medications, agree.
Court:  petition w/d, released to custody of the Dept.   Court talks with Mr. Wolak about behaviors and treatment and consequences of not following plan.  Latzig does want to try to get into a group home setting, he does better with this type of setting.
Statement of probable cause for detention and petition for revocation of conditional release

Defendant Jared J Wolak in court with attorney Courtney J Latzig.  Frederick Ian Bourg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Latzig files Guilty Plea Questionnaire with the Court.  DA Bourg informs the Court there is an agreement.  Request supplementary examination and request Dr. Cummings be appointed to do exam.  After Court accepts plea, parties stip to Dr. Cummings initial report; NGI under 971.17(2)(b).
Court-recites State v. Murdock case; 238 Wi 2nd 301.  DA Bourg responds.  Atty Latzig and Defendant confirms agreement w/ DA Bourg.  
Court goes over the Guilty Plea Questionnaire w/ Defendant.   Defendant is K&V waiving his constitutional rights; understands charges and consequences.  Stip to factual basis; plea of N/C to the 3 counts.  Court finds factual basis and accepts pleas.  Dr. Cummings report is rec'd and NGI is entered; Parties waive right to further hearings including jury trial; proceeding under 971.17.  Atty Latzig submits letter from Dr. Majers regarding housing.  Court DHS has to be involved in this procedure; Orders Supplemental Exam and PreDispositional Exam; appoints Dr. Cummings to perform and Defendant will be kept in Bayfield Co Jail until next hearing.  Asks Attys obtain credit for time served before next hearing.  Court will inform Attys of next hearing; orders victim statements be sealed for the time being and kept in the court file.
Defendant appeared by v/c from Bayfield County Jail
Notice of Motion and Motion and Demand for Discovery and Inspection filed by District Attorney
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Demand for Discovery and Inspection submitted by the Defendant's Attorney with cover letter.
COMPAS report from CJC.  Sealed until sentencing

Defendant is to have no contact with his parents, Robert and Barbara, or their residences.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  undergo a risk/needs assessment.
02-23-2016; conditions of bond modified to include:  Defendant is allowed to have telephone and written contact with his parents, Robert and Barbara.
